definitions.text: a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter
examples: he threw a rock at me

definitions.text: material consisting of the aggregate of minerals like those making up the Earth's crust
examples: stone is abundant in New England and there are many quarries

definitions.text: United States gynecologist and devout Catholic who conducted the first clinical trials of the oral contraceptive pill (1890-1984)
(figurative) someone who is strong and stable and dependable; ; --Gospel According to Matthew
examples: he was her rock during the crisis
Thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church

definitions.text: hard bright-colored stick candy (typically flavored with peppermint)
a genre of popular music originating in the 1950s; a blend of black rhythm-and-blues with white country-and-western
examples: rock is a generic term for the range of styles that evolved out of rock'n'roll.

definitions.text: move back and forth or sideways
examples: She rocked back and forth on her feet

definitions.text: cause to move back and forth
examples: the wind swayed the trees gently
